bell_dialogue.speaker: Builder
bell_dialogue.text: hello. what are we building this time?

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: hello builder, i will tell you this. it appears we are creating a belltower. but first i will start with step by step instructions. we will start with green blocks

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: please start with 8 green blocks extending straight up. this will need to be placed as far right as you can, preferably centered along the other axis

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: on the 8th block to the left of the green block, please create the same structure with red blocks

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: it should start on the ground

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: i only meant 8 blocks away from the first green block, to the left

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: good job builder. if you can do this without a supporting structure then please do. we need yet another row of purple blocks that is 9 long so that it lays across the green and red, on top of them

bell_dialogue.speaker: Builder
bell_dialogue.text: starting and ending from the red and green?

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: now we must create the bell. please start by extending 4 orange blocks down from the middle purple block, as if it were hanging

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: yes. now we need 3 blocks on both sides of the bottom three blocks so that is looks like a 3x3 square hanging off of the purple row

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: great. now please place 1 orange block on the bottom corners of the 3x3 square so that it is shaped like a bell

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: not quite. they should be on the left and right sides, not the bottom side. my mistake

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: good job builder. we have 1 final piece

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: please place 1 yellow block on the bottom of the bell, in the middle

bell_dialogue.speaker: Architect
bell_dialogue.text: you too builder! you are a master craftsman/woman

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: we will start using green blocks

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: i need you to build 4 green blocks straight from where you are standing, all on the ground

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: now i need you to put a green block on either side of the second existing block, on the ground

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: they need to be attached to the same block, preferable to the one closer to you

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: so it looks like a cross

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: now, i need you to place a block diagonal from one of those new blocks, in the forward direction

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: now we are done with the green

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: can you place a red block above the 4 greens with a space in between the green line and the new block?

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: just need 1 block space in between the green and the new red block

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: now can you place 4 yellow blocks on each flat side of the red block?

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: yes it is, you are very observant builder

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: to finish, we need 4 orange blocks to fill in the corners of the 3x3 head of the flower

flower_dialogue.speaker: Architect
flower_dialogue.text: good job builder, we have successfully completed our mission!

l_dialogue.speaker: Architect
l_dialogue.text: are u rdy to get to work?

l_dialogue.speaker: Architect
l_dialogue.text: build a 2x1 structure that is blue

l_dialogue.speaker: Architect
l_dialogue.text: now place 1 blue piece on the left block extending upwards

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: Mission has started.

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: hello. Whats our mission this time?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: we have a difficult one ahead of us this time builder. bear with me

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: describe the structure?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: we will start using red blocks. if you recall from our previous mission we built an open 3x3 square as the second level of our "table

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: this shape is now extending upwards instead of laying flat

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: okay

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: sort of like a window

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: can i build anywhere?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: yes i think that will work

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: now please place a red block on the left and right sides of the window, in the middle of each side

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: these ones?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: yes place them adjacent to those you just removed

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: perfect

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: the second half of this structure is the same using purple blocks, but oriented differently. i will attempt to start you off step by step though

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: so parallel?

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: or perpendicular?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: it is attached to our current structure sort of parallel and rotated 90 degrees. anyway please place the first purple block on the rightmost red block

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: is it connected?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: not quite

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: its as if they were laying side by side and the purple one gets tilted up 90 degrees so it faces the sky

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: oh so its on the ground?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: we can start off with the first few blocks and you will see soon

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: the first purple block needs to be attached to the rightmost block, so that it hangs in the air and is closer to you

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: here?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: if you move that block to the other side of that red block so that it is on your side and not just an extension

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: yes

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: is this the arm of the window?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: nowplease make the open square (window) on top of that new purple block

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: yes it is

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: is this good?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: ok builder i have bad news but it's an easy fix

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: i gave you the wrong side

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: on the back or other side?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: if you could do that exact structure so that its on the left side of the red square from where you were standing it will be correct

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: here?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: yes

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: is this it?

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: good job builder, i am sorry for the incorrect instructions

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: that is correct

window_dialogue.speaker: Builder
window_dialogue.text: you did a good job!

window_dialogue.speaker: Architect
window_dialogue.text: thank you for being my builder

dialogue_1.speaker: Architect
dialogue_1.text: are u rdy to get to work?

dialogue_1.speaker: Architect
dialogue_1.text: build a 2x1 structure that is blue

dialogue_1.speaker: Architect
dialogue_1.text: now place 1 blue piece on the left block extending upwards

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: Mission has started.

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: hello again builder

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: hello

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: we will start using green blocks

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: i need you to build 4 green blocks straight from where you are standing, all on the ground

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: like this?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: now i need you to put a green block on either side of the second existing block, on the ground

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: so on the middle blocks?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: they need to be attached to the same block, preferable to the one closer to you

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: so it looks like a cross

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: like this?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: perfect

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: now, i need you to place a block diagonal from one of those new blocks, in the forward direction

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: like a cactus?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes perfect

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: now we are done with the green

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: can you place a red block above the 4 greens with a space in between the green line and the new block?

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: here?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: just need 1 block space in between the green and the new red block

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: oh i see

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes like that

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: now can you place 4 yellow blocks on each flat side of the red block?

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: its a flower!

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes it is, you are very observant builder

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: to finish, we need 4 orange blocks to fill in the corners of the 3x3 head of the flower

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: good job builder, we have successfully completed our mission!

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: good job!

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: they need to be attached to the same block, preferable to the one closer to you

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: so it looks like a cross

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: now, i need you to place a block diagonal from one of those new blocks, in the forward direction

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: now we are done with the green

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: can you place a red block above the 4 greens with a space in between the green line and the new block?

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: just need 1 block space in between the green and the new red block

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: now can you place 4 yellow blocks on each flat side of the red block?

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: yes it is, you are very observant builder

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: to finish, we need 4 orange blocks to fill in the corners of the 3x3 head of the flower

dialogue_2.speaker: Architect
dialogue_2.text: good job builder, we have successfully completed our mission!

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: Mission has started.

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: hello. Whats our mission this time?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: we have a difficult one ahead of us this time builder. bear with me

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: describe the structure?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: we will start using red blocks. if you recall from our previous mission we built an open 3x3 square as the second level of our "table

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: this shape is now extending upwards instead of laying flat

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: okay

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: sort of like a window

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: can i build anywhere?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes i think that will work

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: now please place a red block on the left and right sides of the window, in the middle of each side

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: these ones?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes place them adjacent to those you just removed

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: perfect

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: the second half of this structure is the same using purple blocks, but oriented differently. i will attempt to start you off step by step though

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: so parallel?

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: or perpendicular?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: it is attached to our current structure sort of parallel and rotated 90 degrees. anyway please place the first purple block on the rightmost red block

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: is it connected?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: not quite

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: its as if they were laying side by side and the purple one gets tilted up 90 degrees so it faces the sky

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: oh so its on the ground?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: we can start off with the first few blocks and you will see soon

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: the first purple block needs to be attached to the rightmost block, so that it hangs in the air and is closer to you

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: here?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: if you move that block to the other side of that red block so that it is on your side and not just an extension

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: is this the arm of the window?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: nowplease make the open square (window) on top of that new purple block

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes it is

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: is this good?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: ok builder i have bad news but it's an easy fix

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: i gave you the wrong side

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: on the back or other side?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: if you could do that exact structure so that its on the left side of the red square from where you were standing it will be correct

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: here?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: yes

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: is this it?

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: good job builder, i am sorry for the incorrect instructions

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: that is correct

dialogue_3.speaker: Builder
dialogue_3.text: you did a good job!

dialogue_3.speaker: Architect
dialogue_3.text: thank you for being my builder
